intro: Calyptranthes yasuniana, commonly known as the Yasuní calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the lowland tropical rainforests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes species such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native region.
